location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 9 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Bombay Government that the Governor of Bushire is attempting to levy a duty of eight rupees on the export of horses, despite having received orders from Hoosein Ali Meerza [Ḥusayn ‘Alī Mirzā] not to levy such duties on British subjects. It notes that the Resident awaits the instructions of either Major George Willock at Tehran or the Governor of Bombay on how to proceed.
